subject: Physical Fitness
title: Fear of Judgment at the Gym
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fear of Judgment at the Gym.

hook.text: Gym anxiety stops millions from walking through the door. The fear of being watched, judged, or laughed at.

buildup.text: The spotlight effect makes us believe others are watching closely. In reality, everyone is focused on themselves.

discovery.text: Studies show most regular gym-goers respect beginners and rarely even notice them. The judgment is imagined.

twist.text: The real judgment comes from within. Self-consciousness projects what we fear about ourselves onto others.

climax.text: Everyone started as a beginner. The person squatting heavy once struggled with the empty bar too.

punchline.text: Nobody is watching. And if they are, they're probably impressed you showed up.

quiz.question: What is the spotlight effect in the context of gym anxiety?
options: Overestimating how much others notice or judge your behavior
The effect of mirrors on self-esteem
